estimate.deltaFromPrevious: +917h (+33%) vs base estimate -- platform factor +35% for ordinary forms 1C:UT 10.2
estimate.platformFactor: +35% (ordinary forms 1C:UT 10.2: no auto-UI-testing, manual form element management, no declarative binding)

keyChanges: Section 0: complete rework -- detailed ordinary forms platform description (event model, modal calls, form elements, timer, blocking strategy)
Section 8.2: common modules reworked -- Server + Global instead of ClientServer. Removed VyzovServera module (meaningless in ordinary application)
Section 8.5: complete rework -- ordinary form wireframes, buttons instead of commands, labels instead of notifications, programmatic visibility, ПриВыводеСтроки for row highlighting
Section 6.3: performance section expanded for ordinary application (70 thick client sessions, server memory)
TZ section 1.7: full rework of platform constraints (3 subsections: mode, development impact, recommendations)
TZ section 7: estimate reworked with per-object-type platform coefficients. Total: 3675h (was 3679h -- minor recalculation)
TZ section 8: acceptance criteria updated -- manual testing for all UI tests, xUnitFor1C for server logic
TZ section 9: NEW -- technical limitations and risks (6 platform limitations, 6 project risks)
Notification mechanism: modal dialogs + form labels + notifications register instead of OpovestheniePolzovatelya

notes: Deep rework of Architecture and TZ for 1C:UT 10.2 ordinary forms. Key changes: (1) Section 0 rewritten with detailed platform description including pseudocode for form element creation, modal dialogs, timer, blocking via register. (2) Common modules: removed ClientServer context, added Global module, added Privileged module. (3) Section 8.5: complete form wireframes for ordinary forms with buttons, labels, programmatic visibility, row highlighting via PriVyvodeStroki. (4) TZ v3.0: reworked estimate with per-object-type coefficients (3675h total), added section 9 with 6 platform limitations and 6 project risks, acceptance criteria updated for manual testing. (5) All references to managed forms concepts verified and replaced.
